question: Gulf cooperation council was originally formed by which of the following?
option4: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates
answer: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates
explanation: Gulf cooperation council was created on May 25, 1981, the 630-million-acre Council comprises the Persian Gulf states of Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. The unified economic agreement between the countries of the Gulf Cooperation Council was signed on November 11, 1981 in Abu Dhabi.
